text: The Centennial Conference Men's Basketball Tournament is the annual conference basketball championship tournament for the NCAA Division III Centennial Conference. The tournament has been held annually since 2008. It is a single- elimination tournament and seeding is based on regular season records. The tournament champion receives the Centennial's automatic bid to the NCAA Men's Division III Basketball Championship. ==Results== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Year !Champions !Score !Runner-Up |- align=center | 1994 | Franklin & Marshall | 63–61 | Johns Hopkins |- align=center | 1995 | Muhlenberg | 88–86 (OT) | Franklin & Marshall |- align=center | 1996 | Franklin & Marshall | 79–63 | Gettysburg |- align=center | 1997 | Dickinson | 90–59 | Swarthmore |- align=center | 1998 | Muhlenberg | 55–53 | Johns Hopkins |- align=center | 1999 | Johns Hopkins | 78–52 | Washington (MD) |- align=center | 2000 | Franklin & Marshall | 75–67 (OT) | Johns Hopkins |- align=center | 2001 | Gettysburg | 68–59 | Muhlenberg |- align=center | 2002 | Gettysburg | 50–47 | Franklin & Marshall |- align=center | 2003 | Ursinus | 96–88 (OT) | Franklin & Marshall |- align=center | 2004 | Franklin & Marshall | 69–58 | Johns Hopkins |- align=center | 2005 | Ursinus | 72–70 | Franklin & Marshall |- align=center | 2006 | Ursinus | 100–82 | Johns Hopkins |- align=center | 2007 | Johns Hopkins | 68–61 | Haverford |- align=center | 2008 | Ursinus | 85–78 | Gettysburg |- align=center | 2009 | Gettysburg | 73–65 | Franklin & Marshall |- align=center | 2010 | Franklin & Marshall | 66–62 | Gettysburg |- align=center | 2011 | Franklin & Marshall | 65–55 | Dickinson |- align=center | 2012 | Franklin & Marshall | 71–55 | Muhlenberg |- align=center | 2013 | Dickinson | 64–40 | Franklin & Marshall |- align=center | 2014 | Johns Hopkins | 60–55 | Dickinson |- align=center | 2015 | Dickinson | 65–62 | Johns Hopkins |- align=center | 2016 | Franklin & Marshall | 75–64 | Swarthmore |- align=center | 2017 | Swarthmore | 68–64 | Dickinson |- align=center | 2018 | Johns Hopkins | 61–57 | Swarthmore |- align=center | 2019 | Swarthmore | 79–61 | Johns Hopkins |- align=center | 2020 | Johns Hopkins | 73–71 | Swarthmore |} ==Championship records== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- !
